definition: life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

sentences.english: Hast thou commanded the morning since thy days; and caused the dayspring to know his place;
sentences.chinese: 你自生以来，曾命定晨光，使清晨的日光知道本位。

sentences.english: God has ordained that people be reconciled to him through the preachingof the gospel by Christians.
sentences.chinese: 神命定人们通过基督徒向他们传福音与他和好。

sentences.english: May the Lord , the God of my lord the king, so declare it.
sentences.chinese: 愿耶和华我主我王的神也这样命定。

sentences.english: I want to sublate that predestined, ominous borderline.
sentences.chinese: 我要扬弃那命定不祥的界线。

sentences.english: And the decree of Esther confirmed these matters of Purim ; and it was written in the book.
sentences.chinese: 以斯帖命定守普珥日，这事也记录在书上。

sentences.english: Master told him, dune appeared on the man is her destined for another half.
sentences.chinese: 师傅告诉他，沙丘上出现的男子便是她命定的另一半。

sentences.english: I'll sublate that predestined, ominous borderline.
sentences.chinese: 我要扬弃那命定不祥的界线。

sentences.english: The man who forms the habit of beginning without finishing has simply formed the habit of failure.
sentences.chinese: 有了有始无终的习惯，就是有了失败的命定。

sentences.english: The only divinely ordained sacraments are baptism and the Lord's Supper.
sentences.chinese: 唯有浸礼和主餐是神命定的圣礼。

sentences.english: Thy testimonies that thou hast commanded are righteous and very faithful.
sentences.chinese: 你所命定的法度，是凭公义和至诚。

sentences.english: He has his Winter too of pale disfeature , or else he would forego his mortal nature.
sentences.chinese: 他也有满目苍凉的冬天，除非他走在命定的时日之前。

sentences.english: You know quite well that we were destined for them.
sentences.chinese: 因为你们自己知道我们受患难原是命定的。

sentences.english: Asaph, Jeduthun and Heman were under the supervision of the king.
sentences.chinese: 亚萨，耶杜顿，希幔都是王所命定的。

definition: in the unseen world of spirits/mysteriously and inexorably
a whole lifetime (idiom); all my life
to receive heaven's command (of Daoist immortals etc)/ordained by heaven
